@graph.name: Pad See Ew – Thai Stir Fried Noodles
@graph.description: These are the best cornbread muffins you'll ever eat! They’re sweet and moist with a beautiful crumb, with bursts of fresh corn in every bite. Plus, these corn muffins are easy to make in 30 minutes - no mixer required. Best served slathered with this cinnamon honey butter!

@graph.headline: Pad See Ew – Thai Stir Fried Noodles

@graph.name: Pad See Ew – Thai Stir Fried Noodles
recipeIngredient: 200g / 7 oz dried wide rice stick noodles , or 15 oz / 450g fresh wide flat rice noodles (Sen Yai) (Note 1)
2 tsp soy sauce (all purpose or light, Note 3)
3 tbsp peanut or vegetable oil , separated
2 cloves garlic cloves, very finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Chinese Broccoli – trim ends, cut into 7.5cm/3" pieces. Separate leaves from stems. Cut thick stems in half vertically so they're no wider than 0.8cm / 0.3" thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Chinese Broccoli – trim ends, cut into 7.5cm/3" pieces. Separate leaves from stems. Cut thick stems in half vertically so they're no wider than 0.8cm / 0.3" thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Noodles – Prepare according to packet directions and drain. Time it so they’re cooked just before using – do not leave cooked rice noodles lying around, they break in the wok.
recipeInstructions.name: Noodles – Prepare according to packet directions and drain. Time it so they’re cooked just before using – do not leave cooked rice noodles lying around, they break in the wok.

recipeInstructions.text: Sauce – Mix ingredients until sugar dissolves.
recipeInstructions.name: Sauce – Mix ingredients until sugar dissolves.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a very large heavy based skillet or wok over high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a very large heavy based skillet or wok over high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add garlic, cook 15 seconds. Add chicken, cook until it mostly changes from pink to white.
recipeInstructions.name: Add garlic, cook 15 seconds. Add chicken, cook until it mostly changes from pink to white.

recipeInstructions.text: Add Chinese broccoli stems, cook until chicken is almost cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Add Chinese broccoli stems, cook until chicken is almost cooked through.

recipeInstructions.text: Add Chinese broccoli leaves, cook until just wilted.
recipeInstructions.name: Add Chinese broccoli leaves, cook until just wilted.

recipeInstructions.text: Push everything to one side, crack egg in and scramble.
recipeInstructions.name: Push everything to one side, crack egg in and scramble.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove everything in the wok onto a plate (scrape wok clean).
recipeInstructions.name: Remove everything in the wok onto a plate (scrape wok clean).

recipeInstructions.text: Return wok to stove, heat 2 tbsp oil over high heat until it starts smoking (HOT is key!). Add noodles and Sauce. Toss as few times as possible to disperse Sauce and make edges of noodles caramelise – about 1 to 1 1/2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Return wok to stove, heat 2 tbsp oil over high heat until it starts smoking (HOT is key!). Add noodles and Sauce. Toss as few times as possible to disperse Sauce and make edges of noodles caramelise – about 1 to 1 1/2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Quickly add chicken and veg back in, and toss to disperse. Serve immediately!
recipeInstructions.name: Quickly add chicken and veg back in, and toss to disperse. Serve immediately!
